references: Next, we compare FFGG combined with Algorithm
as a fine-tuner against non-personalized methods such as Scaffold
and Local GD, and fully personalized method L2GD
. For Scaffold we set outer and inner stepsizes to be equal to
. For Local GD the stepsize is equal to
and stepsize to be equal to
to make the number of local steps to be close to
We test the convergence of the methods changing the number of local steps
(b-d) shows that FFGG outperforms other baselines in all cases. We also highlight that FFGG’s convergence improves when we increase the number of local steps as it is predicted by theory.
